title: PyCarGr – Unofficial car.gr API
author: fforflo
content: readme.md pycargr - unofficial car.gr apisearching a car greece ( elsewhere probably) be boring process. my main search engine use car.gr is largest online marketplace cars greece. i was clicking through checkboxes dropdowns every end to check there are new entries fit search criteria, occurred me i' a programmer there must a more efficient ( fun) to my search. initial solution was simple cron job periodically scanned new entries fit search criteria sended an e-mail.later i started playing around the website's source realized was pretty simple(almost everything is static html) thought it'd sense scrape and maybe some aggregate statistics the results generally play the data. required more structured approach, hence developed pycargrpycargr is unofficial car.gr api backed- flask. provides programmatic access car data search results.search results also exported a nicely formatted csv filealthough initially didn't to include database a utility project this,'d to gentle the website's server; abraham lincoln used say: " you scrape website sure don't hammer servers". is why added redis layer be used a cache the results. data each car are cached 24-hours that corresponding page won't scraped during period. however be configured via config.cache_expire_in if 's set too low will increase chances your ip getting blocked.installationbefore running pycargr api, have clone code this repository, install requirements first.$ git clone git@github.com:florents-tselai/pycargr.git$ cd pycargr$ pip install -r requirements.txtusage run api application, the flask command same flask quickstart$ export flask_app=./pycargr/api.py$ export flask_debug=1 ## you run debug mode.$ flask run * running http://localhost:5000/ running flask_debug=1 sure flush keys under teh pycargr:car:* namespace,otherwise may run one the hard problems computer science: cache invalidationdocumentationcar /api/car/{car_id} - car dataresponse{ "bhp": 180, "car_id": "10068060", "city":
